elements.title: Dendro­psophus branneri (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that male Dendro­psophus branneri frogs (example pictured) have a special "fighting call" reserved for combat with other males?

elements.title: Franz Choque (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while serving as his party's regional leader in Oruro, Franz Choque simultaneously worked as an importer to make ends meet?

elements.title: Mardi Gras Hangover (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mardi Gras Hangover was marketed as a "loop coaster", but was criticized for lacking the characteristics of a roller coaster?

elements.title: Bya Kun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hanthawaddy royal Bya Kun fought for Ava against his enemy King Razadarit in the Forty Years' War?

elements.title: The Inland Whale (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Inland Whale, by Theodora Kroeber, sought to demonstrate the literary merit of Indigenous American oral traditions?

elements.title: first album (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Liverpool Echo described British rock and roll star Tommy Steele as "quite unable to sing and play the guitar at the same time" when reviewing his first album?

elements.title: Carlton Martial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that linebacker Carlton Martial, who recently broke a college football record for the most tackles, began his career as a walk-on?

elements.title: Golden Mirror (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Golden Mirror, a Qing-dynasty medical text, contains a "one-page array of 24 anuses"?
